title: What Does It Mean When You Dream About an Elevator?

steps.title: Change
steps.content: Change In your dreams, the elevator’s ability to lift you up to new levels might represent your rise to a new, exciting chapter of life. This can be a sign that opportunities and positive changes are awaiting you in your personal and professional life. For instance, you might find your dream career, move to a new city, or enter into a loving, long-term relationship. If the elevator is rising very fast in your dream, the positive transformation might feel unexpected and stressful. For instance, a quick engagement or rapid promotion might leave you overwhelmed with new responsibilities.

steps.title: Success
steps.content: Success Elevators take you to higher and higher floors in a building. So, in your dreams, they can symbolize a rise in status and achievement. Having this dream is a good omen that wealth, career success, and positive lifestyle changes are in your future. This is a sign that your hard work is paying off in the real world! Your dedication to learning new skills, saving money , and accomplishing your goals is being rewarded. If you’re having trouble achieving your goals, this dream might be a reminder to think creatively and take a different approach. There’s likely an easier solution that will lead you to success.

steps.title: Growth
steps.content: Growth Elevators are constantly traveling up and down to take people to new places, which might reflect your desire to change and grow in your dreams. If you’re feeling stuck, dreaming of an elevator can be your wake-up call to switch up your routine, take risks , and better yourself to improve your career, relationships, or personal life. For instance, you might try a new hobby, network to meet new people and find a new career, or take a cross-country trip.

steps.title: Higher consciousness
steps.content: Higher consciousness In the world of dreams, elevators are considered symbols of enlightenment that help you explore your unconscious. This dream can be a sign to self-reflect and dig deep to uncover your core motivations and purpose. This can help you access higher levels of consciousness, grow your spirituality, and develop into the best version of yourself. [1] X Research source Explore your unconscious and grow your awareness by meditating , doing yoga , or practicing mindfulness . Journaling about your thoughts can also help you pinpoint your goals, dreams, and desires. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Faith
steps.content: Faith Elevators might not be explicitly referenced in the Bible, but they are still considered powerful symbols of God’s love. Dreaming of ascending in an elevator might represent spiritual ascension. This can be a sign to deepen your connection with the Lord and trust his guidance. [3] X Research source To elevate your faith in God, you might attend church services, read the Bible, pray to Him, or spread His message of love and peace to others. [4] X Research source This dream is also thought to be a positive omen from God and your guardian angel that blessings and peace are coming.

steps.title: Dreaming of an elevator going up can indicate you’re progressing.
steps.content: Dreaming of an elevator going up can indicate you’re progressing. Going up multiple floors in an elevator in your dream is considered a very positive omen. This dream can be a sign that you’re reaching new heights in your career, personal development, and relationships. Take this dream as a sign to stay motivated and focused on your goals. Set deadlines for yourself and then reward yourself when you check off your to-do list. [5] X Research source

steps.title: An elevator going down can represent disappointment.
steps.content: An elevator going down can represent disappointment. Dreaming about descending in an elevator might represent your discouragement at not reaching your goals in your personal or professional life. Your lowered mood might be keeping you from overcoming obstacles that are in the way to the path to success. Take steps to get out of your bad mood by getting back into a hobby you enjoy, hanging out with your friends, or exercising. [6] X Research source Then, refocus and set realistic goals to achieve success. Break your goal down into smaller steps and set a deadline to check each one off.

steps.title: Dreaming of falling in an elevator can mean you feel out of control.
steps.content: Dreaming of falling in an elevator can mean you feel out of control. Seeing the elevator’s cable snap in your dream and tumbling down into darkness might symbolize situations in your real life that make you feel powerless. A tight deadline at work or a major fight with a friend can leave you so overwhelmed and stressed that you feel helpless to fix the issue. When you feel overwhelmed, take a few minutes to breathe deeply or meditate. This can help you calm down and clear your mind. [7] X Research source Then, interpret this dream as a sign to face your problems head-on . Write down your main challenge and then separate it into smaller sub-problems that feel easier to tackle. Reader Poll: We asked 133 wikiHow readers what they find most effective for dealing with nightmares, and 51% of them said I talk about them with friends or family to process my feelings. [Take Poll]

steps.title: Getting stuck in an elevator might mean you feel stagnant.
steps.content: Getting stuck in an elevator might mean you feel stagnant. Dreaming of an elevator breaking down while you’re in it and trapping you in the air can indicate you feel unfulfilled and directionless in your life. For instance, you might feel stuck in a dead-end job or unable to leave an unsatisfying relationship. So, your unconscious might be telling you to make changes and improve your life. Use this dream to let go of things that are no longer serving you. This can be your sign to look for a new job, end a loveless relationship , or break a bad habit . Then, take small steps to change your life . You might take a fun class to learn a new skill, try new restaurants around town, or switch up your hairstyle. [8] X Research source

steps.title: An elevator going sideways can signify forging your own path.
steps.content: An elevator going sideways can signify forging your own path. Traveling through a building side-to-side in your dream can be a positive sign that making risky, unconventional choices will lead to success. Your dream might be telling you to trust your gut and go against the grain when making decisions in your career, relationships, and personal life. Dreaming of a sideways elevator can also represent making lateral moves in your career. This can be a sign to transfer to a different company that helps you learn and grow in your same position.

steps.title: An elevator going the wrong way can represent inner conflict.
steps.content: An elevator going the wrong way can represent inner conflict. Punching the elevator button to go up, only to go down in your dream (or vice versa) might mean you feel pulled in 2 different directions. You might have conflicting desires in your career or relationship that are leaving you unsure of which path to take. For instance, you might get offered a promotion you want that moves you away from your family and friends. Or, you might commit yourself to your partner but feel hesitant about moving in with them. To resolve your inner conflict, reflect on your goals and what is truly important to you. Then, make a pros and cons list to help you make a decision.

steps.title: Dreaming of an elevator that won’t stop might mean you’re dissatisfied.
steps.content: Dreaming of an elevator that won’t stop might mean you’re dissatisfied. Dreaming of bouncing up and down between multiple floors might mirror your frustration in your personal and professional life. This might indicate that you don’t have a clear goal or purpose or that you feel like you haven’t found your right “stop” in life. Interpret this dream as a sign to find your passion so you feel happy and fulfilled. Write down your values, talents, and activities that bring you joy. Then, look for common themes between your beliefs and interests. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Missing an elevator in a dream might represent unaccomplished goals.
steps.content: Missing an elevator in a dream might represent unaccomplished goals. Rushing to get on an elevator only for the doors to close in your face might symbolize goals that feel just out of your reach. You might feel unsure how to take the next steps to make your dream a reality, whether you’re hoping to lose weight or become a famous writer. If you’re feeling stuck on your path to success, brainstorm creative ways to achieve your goals. For instance, you might create a mind map to generate ideas or pick the brains of people who’ve achieved your goal.

steps.title: Riding an elevator with people can symbolize love and support.
steps.content: Riding an elevator with people can symbolize love and support. Dreaming of being on an elevator with other people is considered a sweet sign that your loved ones have your back. If you’re feeling down or stressed, this dream can remind you that your friends and family are only a call away to help lift your spirits and motivate you forward.
